description: Borrowed from French oléagineux, borrowed from Medieval Latin oleāginōsus (“oily”), from olea (“the olive tree or its fruit”).

adjectives.description: oleaginous (comparative more oleaginous, superlative most oleaginous)

entries.meaning: (of manner or speech) Falsely or affectedly earnest; persuasively suave.
examples: The oleaginous salesman convinced me to buy a more expensive car.
